intro: Dorstenia tessmannii, commonly known as the velvetleaf or the creeping dwarf banana, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Musaceae, which includes bananas and plantains, though it is not closely related to the common banana. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Dorstenia tessmannii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
